alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Wilson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 4:43AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Wilson and Montgomery Counties through 600 AM CDT... At 443 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles south of Fall River to 5 miles south of Longton to near Bigheart. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Coffeyville, Independence, Neodesha, Fredonia, Cherryvale, Caney, Dearing, Altoona, Elk City, Tyro, Liberty, Havana, Bolton, Sycamore, New Albany, Buxton, Elk City Lake, Elk City State Park, Independence Airport and Coffeyville Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
